metadata.synopsis: A California lawyer (George Segal) tries to win back his ex-wife (Susan Anspach) from her lazy live-in boyfriend (Kris Kristofferson).

reviews: [Mazursky's] particular brand of lifestyle comedy-drama, involving marriage and divorce and sex and pot and psychiatry in Los Angeles, is as dreary and old hat and contrived as [Bob & Carol & Ted & Alice] seemed at the time.
It's overlong but George Segal provides it with all the charm it needs.
Blume in Love has a quality that's hard to analyze but impossible to miss: It sets up an intimate rapport with its audiences.
